com.github.glusk2.sprouts.core.moves

Class MiddleSprout

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.glusk2.sprouts.core.moves.MiddleSprout

  • public final class MiddleSprout
extends Object
    A middle sprout.

    You can think of this class as a Vertex that exposes a different API. The information about its position and color is implicit. Every sprout is a black vertex by convention. The position of this Vertex can be computed from the methods of this class: 

     Vector2 position = this.submove()
                        .polyline()
                        .points()
                        .get(this.submovePolylineIndex());

    The procedure to find the middle sprout

    Iterate all submoves of a given move. Find the first point on a submove that is at most vertexGlueRadius away from middleSproutPosition. This is the middle sprout! Store the submove and the index of the point on the polyine.

    We will not allow the middle sprout to be within the 2 * vertexGlueRadius radius of any submove endpoint.

      Constructors

      Creates a new middle sprout.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MiddleSprout

        public MiddleSprout(Move move,
                    Vector2 middleSproutPosition,
                    float vertexGlueRadius)
        Creates a new middle sprout.
        Parameters:
        move - this is the move on which a sprout is to be placed
        middleSproutPosition - this is the point where player wants to place a sprout
        vertexGlueRadius - the acceptable margin of error by which middleSproutPosition can be placed off the move

    • Method Detail

      • submove

        public SproutsEdge submove()
        The submove on which this middle sprout is being placed.
        Returns:
        The submove returned as edge. Can be null if player placed the middle sprout on an invalid location.

      • submovePolylineIndex

        public int submovePolylineIndex()
        The index of an element in: this.submove().polyline().points() that represents this middle sprout's position.
        Returns:
        A non-negative integer that represents a list index. If the index returned is negative, player placed the middle sprout on an invalid location.
